FitEmissionLines2D¶

class misfit.FitEmissionLines2D(galaxy=None, instrument=None, instrument_img=None, linegroup_name=None, linenames_arr=None, restwave_arr=None, flux_ratio_arr=None, kinProfile=<misfit.model.kin_classes.KinProfileFiducial object>, intensityProfile=<misfit.model.kin_classes.IntensityProfileFiducial object>, kinModelOptions=<misfit.model.kin_model.KinModel2DOptions object>, thetaPrior=None, thetaSettings=None, mcmcOptions=<misfit.fit.fit_core.MCMC2DOptions object>, theta_linked_posteriors=None, mcmc_results=<misfit.fit.fit_core.MCMCResults object>, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Fit the kinematics of a 2D spectrum, using a set of lines.

Define a spectrum made of multiple linesets set of emission lines and profiles for 2D spectra of a single lineset
(eg, Ha, OIII doublet, ...)
Input:
galaxy galaxy class
Needs to have structural parameters:
n, q, R_E (arcsec), delt_PA (calculated as part of fit_prep_calc
from inst+gal+spec2D angles)

spec1D 1D spectrum for the galaxy spec2D 2D spectrum for the galaxy pstamp pstamp image of the galaxy Note: spec2D.instrument_resolution should be in km/s

instrument:
spectrograph. Needs
instrument_resolution [km/s] PSF_FWHM [arcsec] pixscale [arcsec/pixel]
instrument_img:
imaging instrument. Needs
PA of imaging (for getting misalignment angles)
linegroup_name name of line group to fit
(eg, ‘Halpha’ is just Ha, ‘OIII’ is the doublet)
Optional:

linenames_arr = set of linenames for each group of lines restwave_arr = set of restwaves for each group of lines flux_ratio_arr = relative fluxes of lines to be used in model trim_restwave_range = restframe wavelength to trim the spectra for fitting trim_wave_paramfile = file with wavelength to trim the spectrum for fitting del_obs_lam = +- obs angstroms for optimizing z ; default = 20.

kinProfile = KinProfile class, containing info about generating .vel(r), .sigma(r)
Fiducial: Arctan velocity + constant dispersion.
theta = [Va, rt, sigma0, m0shift, lam0]
intensityProfile = IntensityProfile class, contains info about light dist for galaxy.
Fiducial: Sersic + exponential taper vertically
Will create model class
has subclass bestfit containing all the best-fit values + errors
Initializing object ensures the fit preparation calculations are done on galaxy.spec2D
Can use trimmed spectrum + prepared calculations to determine sane theta bounds.

Methods Documentation

analyze_results()[source]¶
Analyze the MCMC results:
Calculations on sampler chain, plotting of best-fit values
copy()[source]¶
fit(**kwargs)[source]¶
Run the MCMC fitting. Requires input of class Theta2DSettings instance,
which handles the fitting parameters required for the kinProfile functions, and with and additional, last two paramters as m0_shift and z.
get_chain_results()[source]¶
load_bestfit_model()[source]¶

Restore pickled fitEmis2D class, including analysis calculations.

reload_results(doPlot=False, resave_bestfit=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Reload results from files, without re-running

run_mcmc()[source]¶
save_bestfit_model()[source]¶

Pickle the entire fitEmis2D class to a pickle for restoring later. May be very large depending on original data saved in the fitEmis2D class.

setAttr(**kwargs)[source]¶

Set/update arbitrary attribute list with **kwargs

set_bestfit(theta_fitting)[source]¶

Save a copy of the best-fit parameter model, including model, theta, theta_var

setup()[source]¶
setup_model()[source]¶

Initialize model, parameters, + bounds. Can be called independently of fit. Need to set bounds for definiting initial walker positions.

update_model(theta_fitting=None)[source]¶
